title: 中南大学土木工程学院名师名家论坛——Development of high-performance structural systems for seismic applications（系列四）
location: 中南大学铁道校区土木楼310#
html_content:
学术报告发布时间：2015-11-22    浏览次数:989报告题目：中南大学土木工程学院名师名家论坛——Development of high-performance structural systems for seismic applications（系列四）报 告 人： Tony T.Y. Yang, Ph.D., P.Eng.                 Tony T.Y. Yang, Ph.D., P.Eng.
Department of Civil Engineering 
University of British Columbia时     间：  2015年11月24日上午9:00地     点：  中南大学铁道校区土木楼310# 

	Abstract: Recent earthquakes in Japan and New Zealand have shown that even the most developed countries with modern building codes still vulnerable to strong earthquake shaking. The issue lies in the fundamental approach in the structural design, where the earthquake energy is absorbed through inelastically deformation of the structural components. This design approach leads to unrecoverable structural damages and hefty social and financial losses. The loss due to earthquake can be minimized using high-performance earthquake resilient structures, where designated structural fuses, analogous to electrical fuses, are used to dissipate the sudden surge of earthquake energy. This design philosophy will achieve higher performance and allowing the structure to recover efficiently and economically after strong earthquake shaking. Innovative earthquake resilient structures has been developed in the past. However, there is a lack of practical design procedure that can be used by engineering design committee. In this presentation, a novel design procedure, named equivalent energy-based design procedure (EEDP) for fused structures in earthquake applications is presented. EEDP allows designers to select structure performance objectives when the structure is experiencing different levels of seismic shaking intensities. With the use of the developed methodology, engineers can efficiently select the structural member sizes to achieve the desire structural period, strength and deformation with simple hand calculation without iteration. Hence, it is very practical and useful for the seismic engineering design communities. Two innovative earthquake resilient structures named Linked Column Frame (LCF) and fused truss moment frames (FTMF) are designed using EEDP and presented. Nonlinear dynamic analyses were conducted to examine the performance of these two innovative fused structural systems. The result shows the proposed EEDP methodology is able to achieve the performance defined by the engineer, making this design procedure ideal for practicing engineering community where high-performance structural systems can be developed for seismic applications. 


	Bio: Prof. Yang is a registered professional engineer in British Columbia, Canada. He received his B.Sc. (2001) and M.Sc. (2002) from the University at Buffalo, New York, and his Ph.D. from the University of California, Berkeley in 2006. His research focus on improving the structural performance through advanced analytical simulation and experimental testing. He has developed the next-generation performance-based design guidelines (adopted by the Applied Technology Council, the ATC-58 research team) in the United States; developed advanced experimental testing technologies, such as hybrid simulation and nonlinear control of shake table, to evaluate structural response under extreme loading conditions; developed risk-based simulation models for countries in the North and South America and the Global Earthquake Model (GEM) for the counties in the South East Asia. Prof. Yang’s research has been well applied to national and international research and code committees. He has been invited to over 40 leading research institutes worldwide to present his research. Prof. Yang is one of the 19 voting members of the Standing Committee for Earthquake Design, which is responsible for writing the seismic design provision of the 2020 National Building Code of Canada (NBCC). Prof. Yang is also a corresponding member of the TC9 committee within the American Institute of Steel Construction (AISC), which is responsible for writing the seismic design provision of steel structures in the United States. Prof. Yang is an active member of the Tall Buildings Initiative Project which has developed seismic design guidelines for tall buildings in the West Coast of United States. Prof. Yang’s work has been well recognized by his colleagues, he is the recipient of the 2014 CISC H.A. Krentz Award and the 2011 Kwang-Hua Professor Title from Kwang-Hua Foundation, China.

title: Mechanical behavior of piled-raft foundation for high-speed railway subjected to train loading
location: 中南大学铁道校区世纪楼14楼会议室
html_content:
学术报告发布时间：2015-12-31    浏览次数:275报告题目：Mechanical behavior of piled-raft foundation for high-speed railway subjected to train loading报 告 人： 张锋 教授    日本名古屋工业大学                 张锋教授简介：张锋教授现为日本名古屋工业大学教授。张锋教授于1978年进入南京理工大学数学与力学专业学习；1989年，东渡日本，师从著名学者足立纪尚教授(时任日本地盘工学会会长)，在国际土木界久负盛名的京都大学深造，于1995年获得博士学位。
张锋教授是中国人在日本岩土工程领域升上国立大学教授的第一人。张锋教授对岩土工程及相关领域有着广泛与深入的研究，并取得了丰硕的科学研究成果，目前已发表各类论著近200篇。由于一系列突出的贡献，张锋教授2003年获得日本地盘工学会论文奖（日本岩土工程领域最高学术成就奖）、2007获得年日本土木学会论文奖（日本土木工程领域最高学术成就奖），是唯一的同时获得两项大奖的在日本外国学者。时     间：  2016年1月3日上午9:30地     点：  中南大学铁道校区世纪楼14楼会议室上一篇：葛宇宁教授学术报告：1、不饱和土壤力学架构下低黏性砂土张力强度之研究；2、飞灰于路基土壤改良之评估；3、液化砂土渗流行为之初探下一篇：Life-Cycle Performance of Structures and Networks under Uncertainty分享到：

title: 葛宇宁教授学术报告：1、不饱和土壤力学架构下低黏性砂土张力强度之研究；2、飞灰于路基土壤改良之评估；3、液化砂土渗流行为之初探
location: 中南大学铁道校区世纪楼14楼会议室
html_content: 学术报告发布时间：2016-01-07    浏览次数:279报告题目：葛宇宁教授学术报告：1、不饱和土壤力学架构下低黏性砂土张力强度之研究；2、飞灰于路基土壤改良之评估；3、液化砂土渗流行为之初探报 告 人： 葛宇宁 国立台湾大学 教授                 葛宇宁教授简介：博士，国立台湾大学教授、副总务长，土木工程系博士生导师。1995年毕业于台湾大学获土木工程学士学位，2000年和2003年毕业于美国科罗拉多大学分别获得土木工程硕士和博士学位。2011年获得美国密苏里科技大学副教授终身教职，2011年底回到台湾大学，2015年晋升为教授。现担任International Journal of Geomechanics等4个国际SCI检索期刊副主编、多个国际期刊审稿专家、美国土木工程师学会会员和国际土力学与基础工程学会会员。近年来，主持台湾科技部专题研究计划项目5项，美国交通部、密苏里大学研究计划项目3项，发表学术论文50余篇，SCI收录29篇，EI收录15篇。时     间：  2015年1月11日下午3:00地     点：  中南大学铁道校区世纪楼14楼会议室上一篇：The Drag Crisis on a Subsea Pipeline下一篇：Mechanical behavior of piled-raft foundation for high-speed railway subjected to train loading分享到：

title: Life-Cycle Performance of Structures and Networks under Uncertainty
location: 中南大学铁道校区世纪楼14楼会议室
html_content: 学术报告发布时间：2015-12-18    浏览次数:544报告题目：Life-Cycle Performance of Structures and Networks under Uncertainty报 告 人： Prof. Dan M. Frangopol                 报告人简介：Dan. M. Frangopol教授是美国里海大学首位FazlurRahman Khan结构及建筑特聘讲席教授，罗马尼亚技术科学院荣誉院士，曾先后在罗马尼亚布加勒斯特土木工程大学、美国科罗拉多大学任教，获得过包括美国土木工程师协会杰出会员奖、Nathan M. Newmark奖、T.Y.Lin（林同炎）奖在内的十余项国际著名奖项；是SCI收录期刊Structure and Infrastructure Engineering的创办者和现任主编，“桥梁维护与安全国际联合会”（IABMAS）以及“国际全寿命土木工程协会”（IALCCE）的创始人及现任执行主席；“结构安全性与可靠性国际联合会”（IASSAR）以及“国际智能基础设施结构健康监测协会”（ISHMII）现任副主席，发表国际期刊论文290余篇，国际会议论文500余篇；是结构安全性与可靠性和桥梁工程领域的国际知名学者、土木工程全寿命理论及相关研究的奠基人之一。时     间：  2015年12月21日下午4:00地     点：  中南大学铁道校区世纪楼14楼会议室报告摘要: The performance of civil infrastructure systems around the world is deteriorating at an alarming rate. This performance deterioration is due to a variety of mechanisms including aging, environmental stressors, and man-made and natural hazards, among others. Inspection, maintenance, monitoring, and repair strategies are performed to maintain the performance of deteriorating structures and networks over certain thresholds. The planning of these actions has to be optimized during the life-cycle of civil infrastructure systems in order to ensure optimum budget allocation and maximum life extension of these systems under uncertainty. In this context, this paper presents the main aspects related to probabilistic life-cycle performance assessment, prediction, and optimal management planning of deteriorating structures and networks under uncertainty. Risk and resilience and their integration into life-cycle management are also discussed.上一篇：Mechanical behavior of piled-raft foundation for high-speed railway subjected to train loading下一篇：Structural health mornitoring from infrastructure to highspeed railway分享到：

title: The Drag Crisis on a Subsea Pipeline
location: 中南大学铁道校区风洞实验室（六号楼风洞210#)
html_content:
学术报告发布时间：2016-01-17    浏览次数:276报告题目：The Drag Crisis on a Subsea Pipeline报 告 人： 安宏伟 博士  澳大利亚西澳大学土木与环境工程学院                 安博士简介
Hongwei An, Lecture at School of Civil, Environmental and Mining Engineering, The University of Western Australian (UWA).Hongwei got his PhD from UWA in 2010. The PhD thesis topic was NUMERICAL MODELLING OF FLOW CHARACTERISTICS ON A CYLINDER SUBJECT TO OSCILLATORY FLOW 
He worked as a Research Associate at UWA from 2010 to 2015, working on a Joint Industry Project to investigate the stability of subsea pipeline on an erodible seabed.Hongwei was appointed a lecture position at UWA and at 时     间：  2016年1月19日上午9:00地     点：  中南大学铁道校区风洞实验室（六号楼风洞210#)
	Abstract: For an isolated cylinder subject to steady current, the primary governing parameter is the Reynolds number (inertia force/viscous force, = UD/nu). Within a very large range of Re ( 1000~3x10^5), the drag coefficient of the cylinder remains nearly a constant of 1.2, and then experiences a sudden reduction to about 0.3 in a very narrow range (3x10^5~5x10^5). This sudden reduction is the so-called  Drag Crisis. In this seminar, an investigation about the drag crisis of a cylinder near a plane boundary will be reported. The research was carried out through both numerical and experimental method. The results show that the drag crisis for a cylinder near a plane boundary is significantly affected by the gap to diameter ratio. With the reduction of the gap ratio, the critical Reynolds number for drag crisis becomes lower gradually and the range of the drag reduction becomes less. This is attributed to the increase of turbulence intensity at the pipe level with the reduction of the gap to diameter ratio.

title: 桥梁减震研究体会、实践与展望
location: 中南大学铁道校区高速铁路建造技术国家工程实验室1号楼310室
html_content: 学术报告发布时间：2016-01-18    浏览次数:540报告题目：桥梁减震研究体会、实践与展望报 告 人： 袁万城 教授   同济大学                 袁万城教授简介：男，1962年10月生，江西湖口人，1984年本科毕业于同济大学桥梁工程专业，1987年和1990年于同济大学桥梁工程专业分别获得硕士（导师：范立础院士）和博士学位（导师：项海帆院士）。1990年至今在同济大学桥梁工程系工作。1991年晋升为讲师，1994年春破格晋升为副研究员，同年再次破格晋升为研究员，1996年被批准为桥梁与隧道工程专业博士生导师。享受国务院政府特殊津贴。1996年至2000年担任同济大学桥梁工程系主任。长期从事桥梁振动、抗震及安全评价方面的研究工作，在桥梁抗震可靠度理论、多介质耦合效应、纤维混凝土以及桥梁新型减隔震理念与装置等方面取得了多项成果。承担过国内多座大桥的抗震设计研究项目，主持或参与完成了国家攀登B计划项目、国家科技支撑计划项目以及国家自然科学基金项目等多项纵向科研项目。参与了《公路桥梁抗震设计规范》的两次修订和《公路悬索桥设计规范》(抗震部分)、建设部《城市桥梁抗震设计规范》的编写。在国内外学术期刊与会议上发表论文130多篇，其中SCI与EI检索70多篇。研究成果获2009年国家科技进步奖一等奖1项，省部级科技进步奖一等奖1项、二等奖2时     间：  2016年1月18日下午3:00地     点：  中南大学铁道校区高速铁路建造技术国家工程实验室1号楼310室下一篇：The Drag Crisis on a Subsea Pipeline分享到：
